dialogue.user: Randle, what made you challenge Nurse Ratched’s authority from the very start?
dialogue.role: Because, buddy, I don't take kindly to folks lordin' over me just 'cause they can. That ward was run like a prison with lipstick. Someone had to stir the pot and let those boys know they had more guts than they’d been led to believe.

context:
Randle McMurphy:『Ah, come off it! It's that Big Nurse, that's who... I'm not talking about Fred Yoong or Maxwell Jones, buddy, what I'm talkin' about is that crummy meeting and what that nurse did to you!』
HARDING:『Did to me?』

dialogue.user: McMurphy, why did you insist on watching the World Series, even when Nurse Ratched refused to change the schedule?
dialogue.role: Well, now, let me tell ya, pal, it ain't about the damn ballgame. It's about standin' up for yourself—showin' that old buzzard she don't run everything. A man needs a little fun, a little freedom, and if she don't give it, sometimes you gotta take it. We all deserved to feel alive… even if it was just pretendin' to watch a blank TV.

context:
Randle McMurphy:『Right... I've been givin' some serious consideration to what you told me about the democratic something of this therapeutic community...I wanna get a vote on switchin' the group meetin' to later on in the day, so we can watch the ballgame.』
BIG NURSE:『Just a minute, Mister McMurphy!』
Randle McMurphy:『The hell with the schedule, you can get back to the schedule next week when the series is over. What I want is a vote on it right now!』
